SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.eclipse.gef4.geometry.shapes
Class Line

java.lang.Object
  org.eclipse.gef4.geometry.shapes.Line
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Geometry
public class Line
extends Object
implements Geometry

Represents the geometric shape of a line (or linear curve). Note that while all manipulations (e.g. within shrink, expand) within this class are based on double precision, all comparisons (e.g. within contains, intersects, equals, etc.) are based on a limited precision (with an accuracy defined within PrecisionUtils) to compensate for rounding effects.

See Also:
Serialized Form

public boolean contains(Point p)
Description copied from interface: Geometry
Returns whether the given Point is contained within this Geometry. This includes the case that the Point lies on the border of this Geometry.

Specified by:
contains in interface Geometry
Parameters:

equals

public boolean equals(double x1,
                      double y1,
                      double x2,
                      double y2)
Tests whether this Line is equal to the line given implicitly by the given point coordinates.

Parameters:
x1 - the x-coordinate of the start point of the line to test
y1 - the y-coordinate of the start point of the line to test
x2 - the x-coordinate of the end point of the line to test
y2 - the y-coordinate of the end point of the line to test
Returns:
true if the given start and end point coordinates are (imprecisely) equal to this Line 's start and end point coordinates

getIntersection

public Point getIntersection(Line l)
Returns the single intersection point between this Line and the given one, in case it exists. Note that even in case intersects(org.eclipse.gef4.geometry.shapes.Line) returns true, there may not be a single intersection point in case both lines overlap in more than one point.

Parameters:
l - the Line, for which to compute the intersection point
Returns:
the single intersection point between this Line and the given one, in case it intersects, null instead

getP1

public Point getP1()
Returns a Point representing the start point of this Line

Returns:
a new Point with the x and y coordinates of this Line's start point

getP2

public Point getP2()
Returns a Point representing the end point of this Line

Returns:
a Point with the x and y coordinates of this Line 's end point

getPoints

public Point[] getPoints()
Returns an array, which contains two Points representing the start and end points of this Line

Returns:
an array with two Points, whose x and y coordinates match those of this Line's start and end point

getTransformed

public Geometry getTransformed(AffineTransform localTransform)
Description copied from interface: Geometry
Returns a new Geometry, which represents the given Geometry after the application of the given AffineTransform. In case the AffineTransform may be performed type intrinsic (e.g. scaling on a Rectangle), an object of the same type is returned.

Specified by:
getTransformed in interface Geometry
Parameters:
localTransform - The AffineTransform to be applied
Returns:
A new Geometry object representing this Geometry after the application of the given AffineTransform.
See Also:
Geometry.getTransformed(AffineTransform)

Tests whether this Line and the given one intersect, i.e. if they share at least one common point.

intersects

public boolean intersects(Rectangle r)
Description copied from interface: Geometry
Returns true if the input Rectangle intersects this Geometry, i.e. there is at least one common point. This includes the case that the given rectangle is fully contained.

Specified by:
intersects in interface Geometry
Parameters:
r - The Rectangle for the intersection test
Returns:
true if the input Rectangle and this Geometry have at least one common point.

Geometry.intersects(Rectangle)

public int[] toSWTPointArray()
